notesStmt.p: This ci, like others by Li Qingzhao, wistfully recalls past experiences. Here the poet-speaker remembers a drunken evening and her efforts to return home by boat.

projectDesc.p: To the tune “As If in a Dream”—"I Often Recall" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “As If in a Dream”—"I Often Recall"
I often recall the sunset by Xiting Xiting is a famous natural spring in Jinan province, northern China.:
I was drunk and didn't know the way back.
I enjoyed myself entirely and, when it got late, started walking back to the boat.
I mistakenly walked deep into the lotuses.
startling a bank of gulls and egrets into flight.
